title: Path Equivalence: &#x27;/multiple/trailing/slash//&#x27;
overview: A software system that accepts path input in the form of multiple trailing slash (&amp;#x27;/multiple/trailing/slash//&amp;#x27;) without appropriate validation can lead to ambiguous path resolution and allow an attacker to traverse the file system to unintended locations or access arbitrary files.
remediation: ::PHASE:Implementation:STRATEGY:Input Validation:EFFECTIVENESS::DESCRIPTION:Inputs should be decoded and canonicalized to the application&#x27;s current internal representation before being validated (CWE-180). Make sure that the application does not decode the same input twice (CWE-174). Such errors could be used to bypass whitelist validation schemes by introducing dangerous inputs after they have been checked.::
